Job Title: Team Lead Fabrication - 2nd Shift

Location: Brooklyn Park, MN

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
Career Area

Operations

Job Description

 Your Work Shapes the World at Caterpillar Inc. 

When you join Caterpillar, you're joining a global team who cares not just about the work we do – but also about each other. We are the makers, problem solvers, and future world builders who are creating stronger, more sustainable communities. We don't just talk about progress and innovation here – we make it happen, with our customers, where we work and live. Together, we are building a better world, so we can all enjoy living in it.

 Your Work Shapes the World 

Whether it be groundbreaking products, best in class solutions or creating a lifelong career, you can do the work that matters at Caterpillar. With a 95-year legacy of quality and innovation and 150 locations in countries around the world, your impact spans the globe.

When you join  Caterpillar,  you are joining a team of makers, innovators, and doers. We are the people who roll up our sleeves and do the work to build a better world. We don’t just talk about progress and innovation. We make it happen. And we are proud of that, because it helps our customers build and power the world we live in – the roads, hospitals, homes and infrastructure. Without a dedicated workforce Caterpillar could not effectively meet our customer’s needs. Apply today, let’s start supporting you in your career at Caterpillar!

Applications must be complete to be considered. Please include an attached resume or fully completed job history application fields** 

 What to Expect Day to Day:   **THIS IS A 2ND SHIFT ROLE** 

In the role of  Fabrication Team Lead,  you will provide leadership to the fabrication (CNC machining, burn table, and press brake operations) production work areas and to facilitate continuous improvement to reach PQVC goals and ensure customer satisfaction. In this role you will oversee CNC equipment including CNC burning machines, press brake, horizontal and vertical machining centers according to company drawings, specification, and workmanship standards. Current equipment centers include Kinetic burn tables, LVD press brake, and Hass/Okuma/Mazak/G&L machining centers. CAT teams support team People, Quality, Velocity and Cost (PQVC) initiatives and daily activities.

What We Offer

 13 Days’ vacation first year  Paid winter holiday plant closure as production allows  10 paid holidays, 1 volunteer Day, 1 floating holiday  Day 1 Benefits - Total Rewards: health, dental, 401K w/ a 6% match + additional annual company contribution, + additional wellness options  Bonus/Incentive: Quarterly Gain Sharing up to 10%  Development and career growth opportunities across Caterpillar  Cafeteria and an on-site deli case  Secure facility with ample parking 

Required Qualification For Consideration

 3 years’ CNC machining and fabrication experience in a job shop environment or educational certification in machining.  Ability to read fabrication blueprints/engineering drawings, write continuous improvement cards, electronically update standard work, and communicate electronically.  Ability to read standard work, prints, and write continuous improvement cards. 

Top Candidates Will Bring

 Prior leadership experiences, either personal or professional, possessing the skills to mentor and direct others  Mechanical aptitude to use basic fabrication hand tools and equipment (i.e. measuring devices, hand tools, grinders, and other special deburring tools)  Understanding of geometric dimension and tolerances (GD&T)  Knowledge of Statistical Process Control (SPC)  Ability to identify and communicate tooling and machine problems  Comfortable with intermediate use of computers for production transactions  Understanding of the metric measurement systems  Certification in a trade school in related area  Understanding of lean principles, production processes and quality systems.  Heavy crane equipment experiences 

Essential Duties Day To Day

 Responsible for putting safety first with a goal to prevent all injuries, occupational illnesses, and safety incidents.  Use measuring devices and blueprints to inspect parts for quality using statistical process control (SPC) for documentation.  Monitor, prioritize, and escalate daily machined and burn table part needs, identify what needs to be processed for the day and execute the most efficient setup that meets part requirements and production demand. Monitor WIP requirements to ensure the number of parts in WIP meet the production schedule and current customer needs.  Troubleshoot machine and tooling problems as needed. Identify, document, and communicate problems related to machining and report discrepancies and recommend solutions. Support maintenance programs for CNC machining and burn table equipment.  Lead daily production (PQVC), which may include updating daily & weekly metrics, providing input on schedule adjustments, adjusting manpower within value stream teams, and participating in daily production dialogs with team and management.  Work with support functions to identify and resolve issues related to safety, quality, velocity, and cost.  Provide coverage for team member absences and/or production fluctuation.  Operate CNC fabrication equipment following engineering and manufacturing prints, follow documentation for adjusting and completing production jobs. Setup and operate all equipment with stops, clamps, fixtures, tooling, and offsets to produce consistent quality parts.  Coordinate continuous improvement to maintain and emphasize standard work by identifying, driving, and sustaining improvements. Take initiative to identify, document, communicate and correct problems related to fabrication, report discrepancies and recommend solutions.  Train and develop employees on job skills, problem solving and cross training. Provide recognition to employee contributions.  May provide input to employee reviews.  Support the movement of materials for Fabrication and Paint areas.  Electronically and manually maintain documentation for labor hour records, process work order and production documentation.  Take initiative to identify, document, communicate and correct problems, report discrepancies and recommend solutions.  Support team People, Quality, Velocity and Cost (PQVC) initiatives and daily activities.  Work and interact effectively in a team environment in alignment with our Code of Conduct and Values in Action.  Will work autonomously with limited supervision and may perform other tasks as needed. 

Additional Information

 Shift:  2nd Shift

 Hours:  02:00PM-10:00PM

 Work Location:  Brooklyn Park, MN

 Compensation: Grade L09 

Work Environment & Physical Expectations

 Exposure to welding fumes  Exposure to magnets that may impact medical devices  Exposure to machining chemicals  Noise levels of 85db or greater  Operate overhead cranes, jib cranes and hoists  Lift up to 35lbs frequently  Work at multiple heights  Climb on equipment, machines, ladders, man lifts and various step stools  Stand for a minimum of 8 hour shifts with minimal breaks  Work in environment with frequently changing temperatures  Kneel, squat, and crawl on knees  Work in awkward positions, including forward reach, lateral reach, squat, overhead reaching, twisting and forward head and rotation of neck.  Work in tight spaces  Repetitive grasping, pushing, pulling rotating  Use of fine motor skills  Use of hand tools including grinder, air tools, pliers, reamers, etc.  Required Personal Protective Equipment: hearing protection, safety glasses and steel toed/metatarsal foot gear. 

Benefits

Our goal at Caterpillar is for you to have a rewarding career. Our teams are critical to the success of our customers who build a better world.

Here you earn more than just an hourly wage, because we value your performance, we offer a total rewards package that provides day one benefits (medical, dental, vision, RX, and 401K) along with the potential of a monthly bonus.

Additional benefits include paid vacation days and paid holidays (prorated based upon hire date). Day one eligibility- must complete benefits information during orientation.

 Applications must be complete to be considered. Please include an attached resume or job history entries. 

 Relocation assistance is not available for this position.   

This employer is not currently hiring foreign national applicants that require or will require sponsorship tied to a specific employer, such as H, L, TN, F, J, E, O.  As a global company, Caterpillar offers many job opportunities outside of the U.S. which can be found through our employment website at www.caterpillar.com/careers

Posting Dates

April 18, 2024 - April 30, 2024

Any offer of employment is conditioned upon the successful completion of a drug screen.

EEO/AA Employer. All qualified individuals - Including minorities, females, veterans and individuals with disabilities - are encouraged to apply.

Not ready to apply? Join our Talent Community .

Experience Level (if available): None
